articles.content:
Withdrawal of SL urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- The 9th-term Western S
 seoul District Federation of University Student Councils reportedly issued a statement on Oct. 17 denouncing the South Korean authorities for walking away and detaining the chairman, vice-chairman and another student of the general student council of Sogang University.
 Recalling that the three persons have led students to take the road of the anti-U.S. struggle, the statement criticized the authorities for misrepresenting patriotism as treachery and continuing to suppress patriotic and righteous students and the (South) Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) by invoking the "Security Law", an evil law of the old era.    
 The authorities should pay heed to the desire of the fellow countrymen for reunification and the requirements of the people, immediately cancel the SL, withdraw the unreasonable labelling of Hanchongryon as the organization "benefiting the enemy" at once and release the detained patriotic students unconditionally, the statement stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean authorities' rearrest of Tan Pyong Ho assailed
Reform of S. Korean universities called for
articles.content:
S. Korean authorities' rearrest of Tan Pyong Ho assailed 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- The (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held rallies at Seoul railway station plaza and ten other areas simultaneously on Oct. 20, at which it strongly denounced the authorities for rearresting and prosecuting its chairman Tan Pyong Ho, according to Radio No. 1 from Seoul.
 The organization at the rallies said that the "government's" prosecution of the chairman was an act of ignoring the desire of workers who have sustained sufferings since the start of the crisis of foreign exchange.    
 It vowed to launch an all-out rescue movement including a signature campaign demanding the release of the chairman together with citizens and public organizations at home and abroad.

articles.title: Greetings to Austrian President
articles.content:
Reform of S. Korean universities called for 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- The "National Consultative Council of Professors for Democratization" and six other professor organizations in South Korea held a press conference in Seoul on October 22 and went on a signature campaign for 10,000-professor declaration demanding the reform of universities, according to the South Korean Kyunghyang Daily News.
 The organizations at the press conference said that the neo-liberalist policy of the "ministry of education" to introduce the principle of market into the operation of universities, the repeal of the amendment to the "private school act", etc. compelled the professors to come out as the driving force for the reform of universities.    
 They decided to conduct an all-out signature campaign and hold a seminar for the uprooting of irregularities in the campus operation and the democratic revision of the "private school act" and host a meeting of professors within November.

articles.title: Message to chief delegate of south side
articles.content:
Greetings to Austrian President
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Austrian President Thomas Klestil on its national day.
 He extended warm congratulations to the president and people of Austria on the occasion.    
 Expressing conviction that the friendly relations between the two countries would steadily develop on good terms, he sincerely wished the Austrian people peace and well-being.
